intro: Mapania cuatrecasasii, commonly known as the Cuatrecasas's mapania, is a rare flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has lance-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and is typically found in high-altitude cloud forests. Its conservation status is threatened due to habitat loss and limited distribution. Mapania cuatrecasasii is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance.
